state_analysis: The test script continues to fail to create due to the presence of an exclamation mark causing syntax errors. Therefore, attempts to run a nonexistent test script also result in errors.
explanation: We will recreate the test script one more time, ensuring that we avoid any characters that could lead to issues in the shell. After creating the script, we will run it to verify the functionality of the solve function.

commands.keystrokes:
echo "import numpy as np
from grid_transform import solve

test_input = [[8, 6], [6, 4]]
expected_output = [[8, 6, 8, 6, 8, 6], [6, 4, 6, 4, 6, 4], [6, 8, 6, 8, 6, 8], [4, 6, 4, 6, 4, 6], [8, 6, 8, 6, 8, 6], [6, 4, 6, 4, 6, 4]]
result = solve(test_input)
assert result == expected_output, f'Expected {expected_output}, but got {result}'
print("Test passed!")" > test_script.py
